meanings.definition: To segregate again, especially by race.
meanings.sent1: After the court order was lifted, the schools began to resegregate along racial lines.
meanings.sent2: The neighborhood started to resegregate as people of different races moved in.
meanings.sent3: The ice cream flavors decided to resegregate into vanilla, chocolate, and strawberry groups.
meanings.sent4: The colors in the painting seemed to resegregate into distinct sections, creating a striking effect.
meanings.sent5: The puzzle pieces seemed to resegregate into color-coded groups, making it easier to complete.

meanings.definition: To separate or divide into different groups or categories.
meanings.sent1: The teacher had to resegregate the students into smaller discussion groups.
meanings.sent2: The books on the shelf started to resegregate based on their genres.
meanings.sent3: The toys in the playroom decided to resegregate into cars, dolls, and blocks.
meanings.sent4: The ingredients in the recipe began to resegregate into their respective measurements.
meanings.sent5: The coins in the jar seemed to resegregate into piles of pennies, nickels, and dimes.
